title: Print, "Sultane Noire (The Black Sultana), plate 28 from Caravanne du Sultan à la Mecque (The Sultan's Caravan to Mecca)", 1748
medium: Black ink on cream laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed across lower margin: Sultane Noire; J.V. del. Sc.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor G. Hewitt
description: Dark-skinned youth dressed as Turkish Sultana sits cross-legged on mound of rugs and cushions. His cloak edged in fur and wears elaborate turban of feathers and jewels, with more jewels at neck and waist.
